bill.title: Substitute for Senate Bill 130 by the Committee on Ethics, Elections and Local Government—Permitting persons voting an advance ballot to correct a signature deficiency, permitting any county to allow voting at any polling place on election day, establishing June 1 as the filing deadline for municipalities where a primary is not required, providing flexibility for when township officers take the oath of office, providing flexibility for school districts for the election of officers and establishing the schedule for meetings and allowing the question of changing the method of election or voting plan to be held at any primary or general election as well as at a special election.
bill.description: Substitute for Senate Bill 130 by the Committee on Ethics, Elections and Local Government—Permitting persons voting an advance ballot to correct a signature deficiency, permitting any county to allow voting at any polling place on election day, establishing June 1 as the filing deadline for municipalities where a primary is not required, providing flexibility for when township officers take the oath of office, providing flexibility for school districts for the election of officers and establishing the schedule for meetings and allowing the question of changing the method of election or voting plan to be held at any primary or general election as well as at a special election.

history.action: Senate Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Ethics, Elections and Local Government
Senate Hearing: Wednesday, February 20, 2019, 9:30 AM Room 142-S
Senate Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Ethics, Elections and Local Government
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
Senate Committee of the Whole - Substitute bill be passed
Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Received and Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Elections
House Hearing: Thursday, March 14, 2019, 3:30 PM Room 212-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Elections
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 124 Nay: 0
Senate Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Senator Bowers , Senator Hardy and Senator Haley as conferees
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Sutton,  Representative Carpenter, B. and  Representative Parker appointed as conferees
House Conference committee report now available
House Substitute motion to not adopt and appoint a conference committee failed
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 119 Nay: 3
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 38 Nay: 1
Senate Enrolled and presented to Governor on Friday, April 5, 2019
Senate Approved by Governor on Monday, April 15, 2019

votes.desc: Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed - Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 124 Nay: 0
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 119 Nay: 3
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 38 Nay: 1

calendar.description: Senate Ethics, Elections and Local Government Hearing
